meanings.definition: To throw or pass something with an overhand motion.
meanings.sent1: She was overhanding the ball to her friend during the game.
meanings.sent2: He always overhands the frisbee when playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The monkey was overhanding bananas to the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The chef expertly overhands the pizza dough in the air.
meanings.sent5: Overhanding the rope to the climber, she ensured a secure ascent.

meanings.definition: The act of hanging something over the edge or top of something else.
meanings.sent1: The overhanding of the painting on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the overhanding of the branches from the tall tree.
meanings.sent3: The overhanding of the towel on the rack made it look like a cape.
meanings.sent4: The overhanding of the banner caught everyone's attention at the event.
meanings.sent5: The overhanding of the curtain created a dramatic effect in the theater.
